The main church of Notre Dame de l'Assomption came here in 1860, and trees were planted around that time.  In 1882, at the request of Cardinal Fesch, the Fathers of Mercy, a missionary organization founded in Lyon by Father Jean-Baptiste Rozan, settled there.  The church was closed for a while from 1901 to 1907.  Fr. There was a change through the efforts of Father F√©lix Protois...  In 1928, Our Lady of Mercy became Our Lady of the Assumption... A dome inspired by the Pantheon in Rome  The chapel of the¬†Convent of the Ladies of the Assumption¬†was built from 1670 to 1676 to the plans of the painter and architect¬†Charles Errard¬†(1606-1689). Errard then lived in Rome; he was voluntarily removed from Paris by the painter¬†Charles Le Brun, 1st painter to King Louis XIV, who saw him as his rival.  The rotunda¬†topped by a¬†dome is a reference to the famous¬†Pantheon of Rome¬†whose origins date back to ancient Rome.
